org.opensocial.auth
Class OAuth2LeggedScheme

java.lang.Object
  org.opensocial.auth.OAuth2LeggedScheme
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, AuthScheme
public class OAuth2LeggedScheme
extends java.lang.Object
implements AuthScheme

Authentication class that uses 2-Legged OAuth to digitally sign requests using a shared secret; this scheme is also known as Signed Fetch and Phone Home. For reference: http://sites.google.com/site/oauthgoog/2leggedoauth/2opensocialrestapi

Author:
Jason Cooper
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

OAuth2LeggedScheme

public OAuth2LeggedScheme(java.lang.String consumerKey,
                          java.lang.String consumerSecret)
Creates and returns a new OAuth2LeggedScheme configured with the passed key and secret, leaving the requester ID field null.

Parameters:
consumerKey - key provided by an OpenSocial container after registering a new OpenSocial gadget
consumerSecret - secret provided by an OpenSocial container after registering a new OpenSocial gadget

OAuth2LeggedScheme

public OAuth2LeggedScheme(java.lang.String consumerKey,
                          java.lang.String consumerSecret,
                          java.lang.String requesterId)
Creates and returns a new OAuth2LeggedScheme configured with the passed key, secret, and requester ID.

Parameters:
consumerKey - key provided by an OpenSocial container after registering a new OpenSocial gadget
consumerSecret - secret provided by an OpenSocial container after registering a new OpenSocial gadget
requesterId - OpenSocial ID of user on whose behalf the OpenSocial calls are being made
